posts.name: david
posts.cooked:
I’m working on a resource with a team of experienced mentors, alumni, and students, changing how teams and students approach learning FRC CAD and design (for Onshape). We’ve been in development for ~5 months and have fleshed out the main content we want to release on Saturday, with beta testing through our design community.

We’re looking for mentors from different teams and backgrounds willing to get in a 30-45-minute call and screenshare. We’d love to personally watch you go through the resource, listen to your feedback, and document it so we can immediately implement it before release this Saturday. This last quality control pass is incredibly important to make sure the experience is as good as possible.

If your team struggles with CAD,  you need a resource to reduce your training workload, or you already have a successful design training program, please respond to this post so we can reach out to you ASAP.

Thank you!

I’m my team’s primary design mentor, and I would be happy to offer your group feedback on a call this week. I can provide contact info to a mentor from your group if you reach out via CD DM.

We’ve tried a number of different design training programs over the years with varying degrees of effectiveness, so I’m curious to see what you guys have cooked up.

posts.name: Pizzatc
posts.cooked: Whats the resource you’re referring to?

posts.name: david
posts.cooked: You’ll see on saturday

posts.name: David B
posts.cooked: What time-ish on saturday, I’ve used onshape like once and hate CAD since I find it complicated but would love to give feedback.

posts.name: Travis Norris
posts.cooked: Happy to help! I’ll send a dm

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Head Coach - FRC 2423 | NEMC Planning Committee

posts.custom_user_title: Head Coach - FRC 2423 | NEMC Planning Committee

posts.name: david
posts.cooked: I’m not sure what time on Saturday. Do you have time for a call before then? If that’s okay, I’d like to watch you try learning through the guide; if you need help anywhere, we can immediately help asap.

posts.name: Anand Rajamani
posts.cooked: I did this on Sunday and it was excellent. Just an incredible resource. I highly recommend helping with the testing if for no other reason than getting a preview!

posts.name: George
posts.cooked: I can confirm said resource is very useful and in-depth

posts.name: David B
posts.cooked: I finish work a little after 3ish, I have some mentors who are great at CAD but Id love to help idiot proof a guide. (Im the idiot). But I can make time on most evening after 7:00 Except Tuesdays and Wednesdays.

posts.name: tkchan
posts.cooked: Depending on the time that you need to do this screenshare, I would be interested.  We haven’t had a full time mechanical mentor on our team for 2 years now.  We have been on Fusion 360 since 2018 and has considered moving to OnShape if not for the CAM out of Fusion to our XCrave.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: think outside of the box from time to time

posts.custom_user_title: think outside of the box from time to time

posts.name: david
posts.cooked: Send me a message for scheduling, I’m interested.

posts.name: Smtopps
posts.cooked: I’d love to give feedback on whatever this new thing is. I’m not sure if you want feedback from people with lots of experience. I have 5 years experience with onshape and 8 years experience with SolidWorks.

posts.name: Brian Wagg
posts.cooked:
I’ve been using SolidWorks for the last ~8ish years. We’ve made the decision as a team to transition to Onshape this year, and as such have just started teaching myself Onshape (this last week or so) through their learning center.

Would be happy to get on a call if that would be helpful. Otherwise, I’m looking forward to checking this resource out when it drops!

posts.name: Jim Sokoloff
posts.cooked: Interested. I have about 4 years with Fusion and 15 minutes with OnShape.

posts.name: david
posts.cooked: Give me a little bit to set up a calendy to send for scheduling. Thank you for the interest!

posts.name: John Hascall (he)
posts.cooked: We’re a Solidworks team strongly considering switching to OnShape this coming summer (we did use OnShape in 2020/21 so I have a basic knowledge).  I’m available Fri afternoon (CDT).

posts.name: Chun-che Lo
posts.cooked: I’d love to have a look and give feedback.

posts.name: Eric Bergquist
posts.cooked: I’m in the middle of transferring the existing Onshape Intro to CAD curriculum to Google Forms that are less work for the students to interact with. The forms can also integrate into a Google Classroom for score tracking and such. I’ve converted 10 lessons already, but if your tool succeeds more than my implementation then I’d be happy to switch directions. Please let me know when your presentation will be and if you would like any individual feedback before or after. I’m open for a call most times.

posts.name: Rod
posts.cooked: I’m up for it!  I speak decent Creo but iffy OnShape, so I’m a low skilled tester
